channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A lot lot lot lot of big flies, 22nd July
item.description:
Recently, a large number of large flies have appeared in our home and they keep appearing. There are at least 30 or 40 of them. We seriously suspect that there is a problem with the sanitation and safety of the area, or there are dead animals or sewer problems.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Clifton Gardens, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The scaffolding is here over one month., 22nd July
item.description:
The scaffolding at Clifton Gardens 30 has been there for over a month, causing great inconvenience, noise, safety and hygiene issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Clifton Gardens, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Industrial barrels and parking cones in the road this is a danger, 22nd July
item.description:
Barrels and cones in the road and around cars causing an obstruction and danger to both cars and cyclist manouvering around them meaning going toward ongoing traffic ongoing for months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wordsworth Road, Penge, London

item.title: Fly tipped, 22nd July
item.description:
Fly tipped chair, broken chair part and bin bags, possibly by the same house behind this rubbish pile.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Dene, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very near 133 King Henrys Rd, in pavement., 22nd July
item.description:
As per previous report of many weeks back with reference number 7643798. I had an update saying this had been passed to the Highways Team. Nothing has been done to replace manhole cover, which is a clear trip hazard. Someone has marked the raised edge with painted arrows - but this does not look very official. Please can this be investigated/ escalated to prevent potential accidents. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 133, King Henry's Road, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refuse bins being used to save parking space for car. also multiple bins on the pavement along the road, 22nd July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickwick Road, Dulwich Village, London

item.title: Blocked road drain, 22nd July

item.title: 20m tall tree has fallen across the lane., 22nd July
item.description:
Tall tree has fallen across the lane and caught on a telegraph pole. Vehicles larger than a car cannot pass and would be dangerous for other vehicles/people to attempt to pass underneath. The top of the tree is overhanging a nearby school property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Botany Bay Lane, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped stuff, 22nd July

item.title: Repaired pot hole collapsing, 22nd July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Eden Park Road, Eden Park, London

item.title: F/way r/o Tyrrell Ave, Welling adj to A2 has got a large hole, 22nd July
item.description:
F/way r/o Tyrrell Ave, Welling adj to A2 has got a large hole - elderly lady says that there was a sign saying footpath closed to stop people using it, but now the sign has gone. she went to walk down there yesterday and says there is a large exposed hole.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Rochester Way, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On Brooke street between Waterhouse square and DAR 150 fire exit, 22nd July
item.description:
Drainage gulley has been blocked after rainfall. Cars coming past keep splashing water onto the pavement and getting pedestrians wet. Roughsleeper in the area also gets splashed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 150, Holborn, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation from 2A Groombridge Close Welling, 22nd July
item.description:
Overhanging vegetation from 2A Groombridge Close Welling -this is making f/path very narrow and people having to walk out into the road....caller says that she does not have good eye sight herself and says it is dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Groombridge Close, Blackfen, London
